summary: Irregular sleep timing is associated with reduced sleep efficiency and increased fatigue.
implication_logic: If bedtimes vary widely, stabilizing timing often improves energy before extending duration.
intervention_leverage: Stabilize sleep timing before extending sleep duration.

summary: Psychological stress can increase sleep onset latency and reduce sleep depth. Poor sleep can reduce stress resilience the next day.
observed_patterns: Sleep quality low → next-day mood and resilience lower
implication_logic: If stress remains elevated into evening, sleep disruption is more likely.
intervention_leverage: Reduce stress before bedtime rather than extending sleep duration.

summary: Late-night eating is associated with later sleep onset and reduced sleep quality in some individuals.
observed_patterns: Heavy late meal → lighter or more fragmented sleep
implication_logic: If last meal is often late, shifting it earlier may support sleep more than changing food choice.
intervention_leverage: Try an earlier last meal on days when you want better sleep. Consistency matters more than perfection.
